level.text: The utility company shall prepare and submit to the Public Service Commission a Statement of Practicability for Individual Metering for any master-metered apartment house for which termination of service is sought and for which at least sixty percent (60%) of the tenants have indicated an interest in the individual metering option on their Preliminary Election Sheets.
The Statement of Practicability shall contain the following information:
The address of the apartment house;
Whether the entire apartment house can be individually metered;
Whether it is feasible to individually meter less than the entire apartment house;
The total cost of individual metering for the apartment house, the proposed cost to each tenant of individual metering, and the basis for the determination of both of these costs;
If individual metering is not possible, whether the apartment house can be sub-metered and, if so, how (e.g. by floor, by groups of units, etc.);
The total cost of sub-metering and the proposed cost to each tenant; and
Any special considerations pertaining to the apartment house and its service which may have a bearing on the utility’s decision on practicability.
